definition: commerce/merchant/dealer/to consult/2nd note in pentatonic scale/quotient (as in 智商[zhi4 shang1], intelligence quotient)
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.chinese: 无商业行为和商业目的。

sentences.english: Almost all businesses have a mission statement and a vision statement.
sentences.chinese: 几乎所有的商业行为都有任务与远景声明。

sentences.english: The exploration of a new world has turned into business as usual.
sentences.chinese: 对新世界的探索已经转变成了寻常的商业行为。

sentences.english: Personal relationships are by nature not an open business.
sentences.chinese: 私人关系并非天然意义上的一种公开的商业行为。

sentences.english: Exhibition pieces should not be labeled for price or have relation with any other methods of commercial behavior.
sentences.chinese: 展出作品不得有标价及其他方式之商业行为。

sentences.english: This characteristic finds an echo in business conduct.
sentences.chinese: 这一特征也反映在商业行为中。
